channel.title: How do I make the form unable to be Maximized?
channel.description:
How do I make the form unable to be Maximized?
Cause my form looks really bad maximized lol. I know how to stop it from resizing, but not how to stop the user from Maximizing.

item.title: How do I make the form unable to be Maximized?
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Thanks! Man, how did I not see that. :rolleyes:

item.title: How do I make the form unable to be Maximized?
item.dc:creator: @bullzeye95 bullzeye
item.description:
@bullzeye95 wrote:

Haha I got it!

Ok expand BorderIcons and change biMaximize to false. xD

Read full topic
item.source: How do I make the form unable to be Maximized?

item.title: How do I make the form unable to be Maximized?
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Naw, cause then the person can’t minimize the window. Thanks any way Bullseye, but the only way to do it in scar (I think) is to set the borderstyle to bsNone and then insert images and use them as buttons and just not include the maximize button.

Ahh well. Maybe I can set every component to get bigger or smaller as the person maximizes or sets it back to normal.

Read full topic
item.source: How do I make the form unable to be Maximized?

item.title: How do I make the form unable to be Maximized?
item.dc:creator: @bullzeye95 bullzeye
item.description:
@bullzeye95 wrote:

Click on the main form and change the BorderStyle to bsDialog.

Read full topic
